snippet: The Nationals have seen enough, in 83 major league starts, from Stephen Strasburg to understand how few peers can match his mastery of three exceptional pitches.
abstract: Tyler Kepner On Baseball column asserts that the Washington Nationals have seen enough, in 83 major league starts, from pitcher Stephen Strasburg to understand how few of his peers can match his mastery of three exceptional pitches; notes that Strasburg has a tendency to struggle in the first inning, but usually recovers in later innings.
lead_paragraph: The Nationals have seen enough, in 83 major league starts, from Stephen Strasburg to understand how few peers can match his mastery of three exceptional pitches.

headline.main: Nationals Put Trust in Strasburg, Even When He Falters
headline.print_headline: Trusting in an Ace, Even When He Falters
